column1: * Based on gross primary hydroelectric generation and not accounting for cross-border electricity supply. Converted on the
basis of thermal equivalence assuming 38% conversion efficiency in a modern thermal power station.
USSR includes Georgia and the Baltic States.
#  Excludes Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania prior to 1985 and Croatia and Slovenia prior to 1990.
Notes: Annual changes and shares of total are calculated using terawatt-hours figures.
Growth rates are adjusted for leap years.
